description:
cmd/go: don't overwrite when pulling
The linked-to bug was released a year ago.

messages.text:
Hello n13m3y3r@gmail.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

The flag was implemented less than a year ago, which means there are still a lot of people out there in Ubuntu releases that do not have the flag. The change looks good, but I suggest holding off for a bit longer to prevent breaking the "go" command for people that have it working now,
So we can do this in, what, 5 years?

On Fri, Jun 21, 2013 at 1:08 PM,  <rsc@golang.org> wrote:
> So we can do this in, what, 5 years?

12.04 is still the latest LTS. The next one is 14.04, next year. I
suggest waiting at least until then.



gustavo @ http://niemeyer.net

subject: code review 10455043: cmd/go: don't overwrite when pulling
